results.title: Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: However, it is reasonable to have a graduated response to @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular instability@@@ beginning with intravenous fluids, commencement of a single or a combination of @CHEMICAL_Catecholamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002395 @@@catecholamine@@@ inotropes and vasopressors depending upon the type of haemodynamic compromise (@DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular dysfunction@@@, vasodilation).

citations.NLM: Rotella JA, Greene SL, Koutsogiannis Z, Graudins A, Hung Leang Y, Kuan K, Baxter H, Bourke E, Wong A. Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2020 Oct;58(10):943-983. PMID: 32310006

results.title: The effects of antihypertensive therapy on left ventricular mass in elderly patients.
results.text_hl: In a six-month randomized trial, we studied the ability of @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ to reduce @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@ in 42 elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and the effects of this reduction in mass on cardiac function.

citations.NLM: Schulman SP, Weiss JL, Becker LC, Gottlieb SO, Woodruff KM, Weisfeldt ML, Gerstenblith G. The effects of antihypertensive therapy on left ventricular mass in elderly patients. N Engl J Med. 1990 May 10;322(19):1350-6. PMID: 2139175

results.title: [Regression of left ventricular mass in arterial hypertension. Efficacy of 3 different treatment protocols].
results.text_hl: Only @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ induced regression of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@.

results.title: Influence of left ventricular mass regression on cardiac function in hypertensive elderly individuals.
results.text_hl: The addition of @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ resulted in blood pressure control in the three remaining assigned to @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ and in ten of the remaining @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ assigned to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. In the @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ group @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@ index decreased from 104 +/- 5 to 85 +/- 5 g/M2, while it was unchanged in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (109 +/- 9 to 112 +/- 10 g/M2).

citations.NLM: Gerstenblith G, Schulman SP. Influence of left ventricular mass regression on cardiac function in hypertensive elderly individuals. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1990;39 Suppl 1():S25-8. PMID: 2148148
citations.BibTeX: @article{2148148, title={Influence of left ventricular mass regression on cardiac function in hypertensive elderly individuals.}, author={Gerstenblith G and Schulman SP}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={39 Suppl 1}, pages={S25-8}}
